Eric Schmidt wrote in the href="http://hbr.org/web/extras/hbr-agenda-2011/Eric Schmidt-Eric Schmidt"> Harvard Business Review that all of Google's initiatives for year are mobile-centric. We are at the point where, between the geolocation capability of the phone and the power of the phone's browser platform, it is possible to deliver personalized information about where you are, what you could do there right now, and so forth-- and to deliver such a service at scale. Eric Schmidt is, of course, referencing Google's contextual discovery capability, where the search engine without prompting sends users recommendations when it detects through a user's mobile phones that they are in close proximity to something
